titleInfo.title: Select pages from "The National Cyclopedia of the Colored Race," 1919

mods.abstract: The title pages of a 1919 publication titled "The National Cyclopedia of the Colored Race." The volume includes a number of photographs and profiles of African American men and women. The editor-in-chief was Clement Richardson, a faculty member at Tuskegee Institute who became president of Lincoln Institute. "The National Cyclopedia of the Colored Race" was an encyclopedia about subjects of interest to African Americans. It was financed by a New Orleans-based group of African Americans and published by the National Publishing Company of Montgomery, Alabama. An inner page of this copy is signed by John Thomas Patton, husband of Alice Otey Patton.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
